result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joseph A Gordon

defendant.name: Gordon, Joseph A
defendant.address: 106 E Woodruff St 5, Port Washington, WI 53074

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Joseph A Gordon in court with attorney Wilfred P. de Junco.  Defendant in custody. Patti L. Wabitsch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. On motion of the State, this case dismissed and read.

State by ADA Jeffrey Sisley.  Defendant in custody & appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee County Jail and by Atty Alme Boaz as a friend to the Court.  Counsel advises Atty Dejunco will be representing the defendant and is willing to waive timelimits and requesting status of prelim hrg on 9/10.  State requesting $1000 cash bail w/same conditions as pending cases.  Court orders $1500 cash bail w/conditions:  absolute sobriety; no controlled subst/prescrip medic unless prescribed; remain in the home at all times except for school and Court.  Court orders matter adj to 9/10 at 10 am for status of prelim hrg.
